Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
des:
ioBroker software
- combines "smart home" devices,
- is easy to set up and works right away with Alexa.
- is not just an Alexa app, that's much more.
- Provides the ability to connect, centralize, and develop a single dashboard to virtually anything that provides network interfaces to view and test data from networked smart devices at a glance.

You can find a very detailed description here: https://www.iobroker.net/#en/documentation/cloud/iot.md

1. You need a running installation of the ioBroker (on Raspberry, Windows-Server, Synology-NAS or MacOS) wherever Node.js can run (ARM, x86, Windows, Linux, OSX)

2. Create an account on the website https://iobroker.pro:
(PLEASE NOT https://iobroker.net !!!)

3. Please install ioBroker.iot adapter on your ioBroker server and carry in the configuration the credentials of ioBroker.pro account.

4. Then you should get an email with login and temporary password. (Also look in SPAM folder).

5. Find ioBroker.iot Skill (this one is open), and use login plus temporary password from the email.

6. You are asked to change the password. Please do.

7. Done

Each smart device is automatically assigned a name.
The name contains information about where the device is located and what the device is doing.
For example, The name is "workroom light", is assigned to a device "lamp" that is located in the "workroom" and turns "light" on and off.

What's going on:
- Alexa, turn on "device name"
- Alexa, turn off "device name"
- Alexa, set "device name" to "number" percent
- Alexa, increase "device name" by "number" percent
- Alexa, decrease "device name" by "number" percent
- Alexa, set "device name" to "number" degrees
- Alexa, increase "device name" by "number" degrees
- Alexa, decrease "device name" by "number" degrees
